pale.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: having a skin colour that is very white, or whiter than it usually is
pale.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He looked very pale and drawn.
Sharon went deathly pale and looked as if she might faint.
pale.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a pale colour has more white in it than usual
pale.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: a pale colour is very light
He has very pale blue eyes.
a flower with pale green leaves
a light colour is not dark
pastel colours have a lot of white in them
The girls wore pastel pink sundresses.
light in colour because of being washed many times or affected by the sun
The curtains were old and faded.
pale.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if your face pales, it becomes whiter than usual because you have had a shock
pale.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Kentâ€™s face paled when he saw that Rob had a knife.
